Authors:
Miguel Dorcino Xavier, Alexandre Gonçalves dos Santos
Silva-Filho, Felipe Wartchow, Iuri E Baseia
Title:
Just another orange mushroom? The fine-scale diversity in
Rhodocybe mellea (Entolomataceae, Agaricales), with description of new
variety and notes on sclerotia formation in Rhodocybe
Keywords:
Basidiomycota, Neotropical Fungi, Phylogeny, Species
complex, Taxon delimitation.
Abstract:
During collection surveys conducted in the Guaribas
Biological Reserve―an Atlantic Forest fragment in the northeast of
Brazil―a specimen related to Rhodocybe mellea was collected, and
described here as Rhodocybe mellea var. depressa. The new variety is
morphologically characterized by its orange, depressed to umbilicated
pileus, conspicuous sclerobasidia, flexuous-cylindrical pseudocystidia,
and a smooth cutis pileipellis. Phylogenetic analysis of molecular data
(nrITS, nrLSU) and pairwise dissimilarities provides support for the
recognition of cryptic lineages within R. mellea co-occurring in the
Neotropics. We also discuss the position of nrITS sequences of some
sclerotium-forming fungi collected in the same area and evidence the
genus Rhodocybe as a producer of this survival structure.
